definition[0]: if a group of people call for something, they ask publicly for something to be done
example[0]: Human Rights groups are calling for the release of political prisoners.
definition[1]: to need or deserve a particular type of behaviour or treatment
example[1]: Dealing with children who are so damaged calls for immense tact and sensitivity.
example[2]: That kind of abuse is really not called for (=it is unnecessary and unwelcome).
definition[2]: to meet someone at their home in order to take them somewhere
example[3]: I’ll call for you at eight o'clock.
definition[3]: to say that a particular kind of weather is likely to happen
example[4]: The forecast calls for more rain.
definition[4]: to ask publicly for something to happen
example[5]: The company’s second largest shareholder is calling for the public flotation of the shares.
example[6]: He called for Europe to work towards economic integration.
note[0]: call for somebody to do something
